title: How to Refer to Your Grandma in Spanish | SpanishDictionary.com
text: How to Refer to Your Grandma in Spanish Common Ways to Refer to Your Grandma Abuela and abuelitaare the general terms for grandma used in all Spanish-speaking countries. They are used interchangeably when talking about and to your grandma. The main difference lies in the use of the diminutive -ita, which is added to show love/affection. Take a look at these examples! In English, the word grandma should be capitalized whenever you're using it instead of a person's proper name, e.g. I love you, Grandma. Abuela, on the other hand, is never capitalized.
